intro: Allium pseudostamineum, commonly known as the false stamen garlic, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, and its bulbs are similar to those of other garlic species. Allium pseudostamineum is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
